abstract: Peter Thiel, the PayPal co-founder who made millions off his angel investment in Facebook, saw his Clarium Capital Management hedge fund fall 25 percent in 2009 — with a 10 percent drop in December alone — according to The New York Post, citing performance data.
snippet: Peter Thiel, the PayPal co-founder who made millions off his angel investment in Facebook, saw his Clarium Capital Management hedge fund fall 25 percent in 2009 — with a 10 percent drop in December alone — according to The New York Post, citing pe...
lead_paragraph: The markets were good to many investors last year. But Peter Thiel apparently wasn’t one of them.

headline.main: Thiel’s Fund Said to Fall 25% in 2009
